description: Sets time length per step. Minimum 2 microseconds.\n\nThis needs to be reduced from the default value of 10 when max. step rates exceed approximately 80 kHz.
Sets a short hold delay when stopping to let dynamics settle before disabling steppers. Value 255 keeps motors enabled.
Inverts the step signals (active low).
Inverts the direction signals (active low).
Inverts the stepper driver enable signals  (active low). If the stepper drivers shares the same enable signal only X is used.
Inverts the axis limit input signals.
Inverts the probe input pin signal.

Position in machine coordinate,Buffer state,Line numbers,Feed & speed,Pin state,Work coordinate offset,Overrides,Probe coordinates,Buffer sync on WCO change,Parser state,Alarm substatus,Run substatus: Specifies optional data included in status reports.
If Run substatus is enabled it may be used for simple probe protection.

Note that Parser state will be sent separately after the status report and only on changes.
Sets how fast Grbl travels through consecutive motions. Lower value slows it down.
Sets the G2 and G3 arc tracing accuracy based on radial error. Beware: A very small value may effect performance.
Enables inch units when returning any position and rate value that is not a settings value.

dataFormat: Reset,Feed hold,Cycle start,Safety door,Block delete,Optional stop,EStop,Probe connected
description: Inverts the control signals  (active low).\nNOTE: Block delete, Optional stop, EStop and Probe connected are optional signals, availability is driver dependent.
Inverts the coolant and mist signals  (active low).
Inverts the spindle on, counterclockwise and PWM signals (active low).

dataFormat: Reset,Feed hold,Cycle start,Safety door,Block delete,Optional stop,EStop,Probe connected
description: Disable the control signals pullup resistors. Potentially enables pulldown resistor if available.\nNOTE: Block delete, Optional stop and EStop are optional signals, availability is driver dependent.
Disable the limit signals pullup resistors. Potentially enables pulldown resistor if available.
Disable the probe signal pullup resistor. Potentially enables pulldown resistor if available.
Enables soft limits checks within machine travel and sets alarm when exceeded. Requires homing.
When enabled immediately halts motion and throws an alarm when a limit switch is triggered. In strict mode only homing is possible when a switch is engaged.

dataFormat: Enable,Enable single axis commands,Homing on startup required,Set machine origin to 0,Two switches shares one input pin,Allow manual
description:
Enables homing cycle. Requires limit switches on axes to be automatically homed.

When `Enable single axis commands` is checked, single axis homing can be performed by $H<axis letter> commands.

When `Allow manual` is checked, axes not homed automatically may be homed manually by $H or $H<axis letter> commands.
Homing searches for a switch in the positive direction. Set axis bit to search in negative direction.
Feed rate to slowly engage limit switch to determine its location accurately.
Seek rate to quickly find the limit switch before the slower locating phase.
Sets a short delay between phases of homing cycle to let a switch debounce.
Retract distance after triggering switch to disengage it. Homing will fail if switch isn't cleared.
G73 retract distance (for chip breaking drilling).
Step pulse delay.\n\nNormally leave this at 0 as there is an implicit delay on direction changes when AMASS is active.
Maximum spindle speed. Sets PWM to maximum duty cycle.
Minimum spindle speed. Sets PWM to minimum duty cycle.
Laser mode: consecutive G1/2/3 commands will not halt when spindle speed is changed.\nLathe mode: allows use of G7, G8, G96 and G97.
Spindle PWM frequency.
Spindle PWM off value in percent (duty cycle).
Spindle PWM min value in percent (duty cycle).
Spindle PWM max value in percent (duty cycle).
Specifies which steppers not to disable when stopped.
Spindle encoder pulses per revolution.
Enables "normal" processing of ?, ! and ~ characters when part of $-setting or comment. If disabled then they are added to the input string instead.
Limit jog commands to machine limits for homed axes.

dataFormat: Enable,Enable parking override control, Deactivate upon init
description: Enables parking cycle, requires parking axis homed.
Define which axis that performs the parking motion.
Number of homing passes. Minimum 1, maximum 128.
Axes to home in first pass.
Axes to home in second pass.
Axes to home in third pass.
Axes to home in fourth pass.
Axes to home in fifth pass.
Axes to home in sixth pass.
Step jogging speed in millimeters per minute.
Slow jogging speed in millimeters per minute.
Fast jogging speed in millimeters per minute.
Jog distance for single step jogging.
Jog distance before automatic stop.
Jog distance before automatic stop.
Spindle pull-out and plunge distance in mm.Incremental distance.
Spindle pull-out/plunge slow feed rate in mm/min.
Parking axis target. In mm, as machine coordinate [-max_travel, 0].
Parking fast rate to target after pull-out in mm/min.
Restore overrides to default values at program end.
Enable this if it is desirable to open the safety door when in IDLE mode (eg. for jogging).
Enable sleep mode.

dataFormat: Disable laser during hold,Restore spindle and coolant state on resume
description: Actions taken during feed hold and on resume from feed hold.
Starts Grbl in alarm mode after a cold reset.
Allow feed override during probing.
Network services to enable. Consult driver documentation for availability.\n\nNOTE: A hard reset of the controller is required after changing network settings.

'Spindle at speed' tolerance in percent of programmed RPM. Set to 0 to disable 'Spindle at speed' check.

dataFormat: Normal,Manual touch off,Manual touch off @ G59.3,Automatic touch off @ G59.3,Ignore M6
description:
Normal: allows jogging for manual touch off. Set new position manually.

Manual touch off: retracts tool axis to home position for tool change, use jogging or $TPW for touch off.

Manual touch off @ G59.3: retracts tool axis to home position then to G59.3 position for tool change, use jogging or $TPW for touch off.

Automatic touch off @ G59.3: retracts tool axis to home position for tool change, then to G59.3 position for automatic touch off.

All modes except "Normal" and "Ignore M6" returns the tool (controlled point) to original position after touch off.
Maximum probing distance for automatic or $TPW touch off.
Feed rate to slowly engage tool change sensor to determine the tool offset accurately.
Seek rate to quickly find the tool change sensor before the slower locating phase.
Universal: Toggle between Feed rate, Rapid rate and Spindle RPM override modes with single click. Double click to reset to default.\nOther modes: single or double click to reset to default value.
Delay from cut start until THC activates.
Variation from target voltage for THC to correct height.
Percentage of Cut Feed Rate velocity needs to fall below to lock THC.
Higher values need greater voltage change to lock THC.
The amount of time to wait from torch on until a failure if arc is not detected.
The time between an arc failure and another arc start attempt.
The number of attempts at starting an arc.
The value required to scale the arc voltage input to display the correct arc voltage.
The value required to display zero volts when there is zero arc voltage input.\nFor initial setup multiply the arc voltage out value by -1 and enter that for Voltage Offset.
The distance the torch would need to move to change the arc voltage by one volt.\nUsed for manual height change only.
High voltage threshold for Arc OK.
Low voltage threshold for Arc OK.
Invert IOPort inputs.
Disable IOPort input pullups.
Invert IOPort output.
Set IOPort outputs as open drain (OD).

dataFormat: Universal,Feed rate override,Rapid rate override,Spindle RPM override
description: Universal: Toggle between Feed rate, Rapid rate and Spindle RPM override modes with single click. Double click to reset to default.\nOther modes: single or double click to reset to default value.
Encoder Count Per Revolution.
Encoder Count Per Detent.
Maximum time for detecting a double click.
